definition: shifty gaze/furtive glance
thief/traitor/wily/deceitful/evil/extremely
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
see 賊眉鼠眼|贼眉鼠眼[zei2 mei2 shu3 yan3]

sentences.english: Anyway, they had mean eyes, I thought.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎么说，我觉得他们有点贼眉贼眼的。

sentences.english: That guy is very suspicious, his shifty eyes move constantly.
sentences.chinese: 那个人十分可疑，瞪着贼眼左顾右盼的。

definition: see 色瞇瞇|色眯眯[se4 mi1 mi1]
eyeball/fig. the apple of one's eye (i.e. favorite person)
bright/shiny/dazzling/glaring
lustful/lecherous
shifty-eyed/crafty-looking (idiom)
lit. to behave like a thief/furtive/underhand
see 賊眉鼠眼|贼眉鼠眼[zei2 mei2 shu3 yan3]
to squint
sneaky/furtive
eyeball/fig. the apple of one's eye (i.e. favorite person)
to throw a glance at/to peer at/Taiwan pr. [jun4]
(of one's gaze) fixed/staring
(onom.) rolling around/spinning/also pr. [gu1 lu1 lu1]/Taiwan pr. [gu2 lu4 lu5]
whirling/spinning around and around/round and plump (e.g. of fruit)
to roll rapidly/to spin/Taiwan pr. [gu2 lu5]
one's eyes/eyeball
